props.name: show
props.description: This will open the menu

props.name: actionsAttachment
props.description: The position on the actions list that you want attached to the button/target

props.name: targetAttachment
props.description: The position on the target that you want the actions attached to

props.name: openClass
props.description: The class to attach when the menu is opened

events.name: open
events.description: Fired when the menu is opened

events.name: close
events.description: Fired when the menu is closed

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: This will toggle the open state of the menu

methods.name: close
methods.description: This will close the menu

slots.name: menu
slots.description: This slot will change the button from the hamburger menu

props.name: collapsible
props.description: This will close other rows that are open when the row is clicked

props.name: title
props.description: This is the title of the row

methods.name: collapseAll()
methods.description: Closes all accordion rows

methods.name: setActiveAccordion(accordion)
methods.description: Activates the passed accordion row

methods.name: setActive((boolean) active)
methods.description: Toggles the active status of the row. Takes a boolean

slots.name: default
slots.description: This is the default slot. This will be where the accordion-row components will be.

slots.name: default
slots.description: This is the default slot. This will be the content that is in the accordion.

slots.name: title
slots.description: This is the title of the row. If the title prop is too limited this can be used.

slots.name: actions
slots.description: This will be on the right side of the row. If the row needs to have any actions or other content

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the button is disabled or not

props.name: danger
props.description: Styles the button with the danger style (red)

props.name: outline
props.description: Styles the button with the outline style

props.name: spin
props.description: Shows the spinner on the button

props.name: spinColor
props.description: The color of the spinner

props.name: spinSize
props.description: The size of the button spinner (small, tiny). Tiny is helpful for smaller width buttons

props.name: tiny
props.description: Changes the size of the button

props.name: small
props.description: Changes the size of the button

props.name: large
props.description: Changes the size of the button

events.name: click
events.description: Fired when the button is clicked

events.name: focus
events.description: Fired when the button is focused

events.name: blur
events.description: Fired when the button is blurred

props.name: value
props.description: The v-model binded prop on the checkbox input. Should be provided via v-model. If only the prop is sent then you would need to listen for the input event to update the prop

props.name: label
props.description: The label to be used for the checkbox button

props.name: name
props.description: The actual value of the checkbox button

props.name: options
props.description:
An array of objects 
[{Option1}, {Options2}...]

props.name: valueKey
props.description: The key to use in the Object options for the checkbox value

props.name: labelKey
props.description: The key to use in the Object options for the checkbox label

props.name: classNames
props.description: Additional class names to attach to the group

events.name: input
events.description: This is fired when the checked value is changed

props.name: value
props.description: The v-model binded prop on the datepicker. Should be provided via v-model. If only the prop is sent then you would need to listen for the input event to update the prop

props.name: dateFormat
props.description: Format for the date value being binded to the v-model. All formats should include a single 'Y', 'm', 'd'

props.name: displayFormat
props.description: Format for the date being displayed in the input. All formats should include a single 'Y', 'm', 'd'

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the input field

props.name: yearPicker
props.description: Whether to allow the user to use the year picker. This makes the year in the header interactive

props.name: monthPicker
props.description: Whether to allow the user to use the month picker. This makes the month in the header interactive

props.name: minDate
props.description: The minimum date that can be selected. Should be in the same format as `dateFormat`

props.name: maxDate
props.description: The maximum date that can be selected. Should be in the same format as `dateFormat`

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether or not to disable the input field of the date.

events.name: input
events.description: This is fired when the value is changed

events.name: calendar_change
events.description: Fired when the calendar is being controlled. For instance the month/year is changed

events.name: open
events.description: Fired when the datepicker calendar is opened

events.name: close
events.description: Fired when the datepicker calendar is closed

events.name: input-error
events.description: Fired when a value is set out of the range (min/max restrictions). Payload will have the date.

methods.name: open()
methods.description: Used to open the datepicker calendar selector

methods.name: close()
methods.description: Used to close the datepicker calendar selector

props.name: tag
props.description: What tag should be, this uses vue component :is="tag"

props.name: disabled
props.description: To make the draggable not drag.

props.name: activeClass
props.description: What the html class is for the draggable element

props.name: tag
props.description: What tag should be, this uses vue component :is="tag"

props.name: activeClass
props.description: What the html class is for the droppable element

props.name: inactiveClass
props.description: What the html class is for the droppable element when there isn't a draggable element hovering over

props.name: accept
props.description: Opposite of disabled prop. This can be a function that allows the parent component to have more control over the droppable area should allow draggable elements

events.name: dragstart
events.description: When the ks-draggable element starts to drag. This event emits the mouse event.

events.name: dragend
events.description: When the ks-draggable element stops drag. This event emits the mouse event.

events.name: drop
events.description: When the ks-droppable element gets an elements dropped on it. This event emits the mouse event.

props.name: value
props.description: This is the prop that the v-model will bind to. So if you are using v-model you can omit this.

props.name: items
props.description:
This is the list of options. 
[{Option data...},{Option data...}]

props.name: placeholder
props.description: The placeholder in the select when nothing is selected.

props.name: minSearch
props.description: Minimum number of characters typed in the search box needed to trigger the search

props.name: multiple
props.description: Whether or not to support multiple selections

props.name: taggable
props.description: When true the user is allowed to enter values not in the list items.

props.name: groupBy
props.description: The key to group items by. Dot notation is supported for nested values in the items.

props.name: showTagInList
props.description: Depends on taggable. When true the taggable will be shown in the list as "Add {term}"

props.name: delay
props.description: The amount of delay to be used when searching

props.name: searchThreshold
props.description: The minimum number of items for the search input to be shown.

props.name: keepTextOnDelete
props.description: When set to true if a user deletes a selection it will retain the text of the selection

props.name: itemFilter
props.description: When a function is provided it will be used when filtering results from the search box. The function should accept the item as a parameter and should return true for a match. If a String is provided it is used as the key to filter on when filtering items.

props.name: selectionKey
props.description: This is the key used as the value for the items. And it is used to display selections

props.name: listHeight
props.description: The height of the drop down list

props.name: cacheResults
props.description: Whether or not to cache search results.

props.name: paginated
props.description: Whether or not the search data is being paginated. When true the select will emit the search event when the list is navigated to the end.

props.name: paginateThreshold
props.description: Determines when the paginate request will be called. So when the user scrolls down the list if this is set to 3 the request will be made when the user is 3 list items away from the bottom of the list.

props.name: stopParentScroll
props.description: When set to true the list will automatically prevent the parent container from scrolling when the list scroll has reached the bottom.

props.name: emptyMessage
props.description: A message to use when the select is empty. (ex: "No Results"). If left blank then no message will show up.

props.name: acceptEmptySelection
props.description: Works with the emptyMessage property. If this is set to true the empty option will be a selectable item instead of just text.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the value is changed

events.name: tag-created
events.description: When a tag is created this will fire with the new tag in the payload

events.name: deleted
events.description: When a selection is deleted this will be fired with the deleted selection in the payload

events.name: focus
events.description: Fired when the input field is focused.

events.name: blur
events.description: Fired when the input field is blurred

events.name: clear
events.description: Fired when the list is cleared

events.name: selected-empty
events.description: Fired when acceptEmptySelection prop is set to true and the autocomplete term is not in the list.

events.name: search

methods.name: clearSelection(selection (optional))
methods.description: Clears a selection from the selection(s). If not parameter is passed the it will remove all selections.

methods.name: selectionValue()
methods.description: Returns the value of the selection

methods.name: selectItem(item_index)
methods.description: Selects the item at the given index

methods.name: addSelection(selection)
methods.description: Adds a selection to the list of selections when multiple is being used

methods.name: selectUp()
methods.description: Moves the selection up

methods.name: selectDown()
methods.description: Moves the selection down

methods.name: clear()
methods.description: Clears the search field

methods.name: clearCache()
methods.description: Clears the search cache

methods.name: getSelectedItem()
methods.description: Retrieves the selected item from list

methods.name: getItemByIndex(item_index)
methods.description: Retrieves an item by the given index

methods.name: refreshSelection()
methods.description: Updates the selection display. This should not be needed since the autocomplete will automatically refresh the display

methods.name: reset()
methods.description: Clears selection, items, and cache

slots.name: default
slots.description: This is a scoped slot. This is used so that you have more control over the look of the data. The component loops through the data and passes the props with a props attribute. An example can be seem above in either the Multiple selection examples.

slots.name: label
slots.description: This is a scoped slot. It will allow you to control the display of the selection.

props.name: height
props.description: The height of the loader line

props.name: show
props.description: If the loader is visible

props.name: absolute
props.description: Allows the component to be positioned absolute

props.name: zIndex
props.description: Change the z-index property

props.name: title
props.description: The title of the Modal. Displayed in the title bar.

props.name: showHeader
props.description: Weather to show the header/titlebar

props.name: showClose
props.description: Whether to show the close(x) button in the header/titlebar

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: The maximum width that should be allowed for the modal

props.name: minWidth
props.description: The minimum width that should be allowed for the modal

props.name: maxHeight
props.description: The maximum height that should be allowed for the modal

props.name: minHeight
props.description: The minimum height that should be allowed for the modal

props.name: closeOnEscape
props.description: Whether to close the modal when the user presses the 'escape' key

props.name: danger
props.description: Whether to add the danger styling to the modal

props.name: loading
props.description: Whether to show a loading bar in the modal

props.name: closeOnMaskClick
props.description: Whether to close the modal when a user clicks on the mask

props.name: forceScroll
props.description: Whether to force the modal in a scrollable state. This is the same when a modal is higher than the window. This option helps with modals jumping when content is dynamic.

events.name: open
events.description: Fired when the modal is opened

events.name: close
events.description: Fired when the modal is closed

methods.name: open()
methods.description: used to open the modal

methods.name: close()
methods.description: used to close the modal

methods.name: loadingOn()
methods.description: show loading bar

methods.name: loadingOff()
methods.description: hide loading bar

slots.name: default
slots.description: This will be the content of the modal

slots.name: header
slots.description: This will be the header title. If you pass a title prop this isn't needed.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: This is where the buttons will be located or anything else that will be shown on the bottom of the modal.

props.name: show
props.description: If the loader is visible

props.name: height
props.description: The height of the loader

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the spinner: tiny, small, medium, large, x-large

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the spinner

props.name: bg
props.description: The background color or the color of the rail that the spinner is on

props.name: value
props.description: The v-model binded prop on the radio input. Should be provided via v-model. If only the prop is sent then you would need to listen for the input event to update the prop

props.name: label
props.description: The label to be used for the radio button

props.name: name
props.description: The actual value of the radio button

props.name: options
props.description:
An array of objects 
[{Option1}, {Options2}...]

props.name: valueKey
props.description: The key to use in the Object options for the checkbox value

props.name: labelKey
props.description: The key to use in the Object options for the checkbox label

props.name: classNames
props.description: Additional class names to attach to the group

events.name: input
events.description: This is fired when the checked value is changed

methods.name: selectRadio(value)
methods.description: Selects the radio with the given value

props.name: date
props.description: The v-model binded prop on the calendar. Should be provided via v-model. If only the prop is sent then you would need to listen for the input event to update the prop

props.name: selection
props.description: This is a date that should be highlighted as selected

props.name: weekStart
props.description: The day index that the week should start on. 0 = Sunday

props.name: abbrevDay
props.description: Whether or not to use the abbreviated version of the days name

props.name: abbrevMonth
props.description: Whether or not to use the abbreviated version of the months name

props.name: format
props.description: Format for the date value being binded to the v-model. All formats should include a single 'Y', 'm', 'd'

props.name: weekHeight
props.description: This is the height of each week. If nothing is applied then the height is just an auto height. For a clean look it is recommended to use this prop

props.name: interactive
props.description: Whether or not to make the calendar interactive so you can click on the cells. Emits the select event (used with datepicker).

props.name: interactiveDays
props.description: Whether or not to make the days click-able. Different from the 'interactive' prop because this only makes the day number clickable not the whole cell.

props.name: yearPicker
props.description: Whether to allow the user to use the year picker. This makes the year in the header interactive

props.name: monthPicker
props.description: Whether to allow the user to use the month picker. This makes the month in the header interactive

props.name: showControls
props.description: Whether to show the left and right navigation in the header

props.name: droppableDays
props.description: Whether something can be dragged and dropped onto a date on the calendar

props.name: droppableActiveClass
props.description: class to use when an item is dragged over the droppable area

props.name: droppableInactiveClass
props.description: class used when the droppable area has no item being dragged over it

events.name: input
events.description: This is fired when the value is changed

events.name: select
events.description: Fired when a day is selected. Payload includes the date formatted to a string

events.name: previous
events.description: Fired when the calendar controls for previous month is clicked

events.name: next
events.description: Fired when the calendar controls for next month is clicked

events.name: drop-on-date
events.description: Fired when something is dragged and dropped onto a date cell

methods.name: setLang(language)

slots.name: Dynamic
slots.description: This is a dynamic slot component name. The name can be any date in the format that is specified in the props tab. The default is 'Y-m-d' or '2017-01-31'

props.name: checked
props.description: The v-model binded prop on the checkbox input. Should be provided via v-model. If only the prop is sent then you would need to listen for the input event to update the prop

props.name: name
props.description: The name given to the input field

props.name: label
props.description: The label to be used for the checkbox button

props.name: value
props.description: The actual value of the checkbox button

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the checkbox is disabled or not

props.name: inline
props.description: If set true the checkbox will be displayed inline

props.name: switchStyle
props.description: If set to true the checkbox will use a switch style instead of a check

events.name: input
events.description: This is fired when the checked value is changed

methods.name: toggle()
methods.description: Toggles the value of the checkbox

props.name: checked
props.description: The v-model binded prop on the radio input. Should be provided via v-model. If only the prop is sent then you would need to listen for the input event to update the prop

props.name: name
props.description: The name given to the input field

props.name: label
props.description: The label to be used for the radio button

props.name: value
props.description: The actual value of the radio button

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the radio is disabled or not

props.name: inline
props.description: If set true the radio will be displayed inline

events.name: input
events.description: This is fired when the checked value is changed

methods.name: toggle()
methods.description: Toggles the value of the radio

props.name: timeStep
props.description: The number of minutes to step through for the list of options. ***Note: This implementation assumes nice round numbers for timeStep (e.g. 15 or 30 minutes) and minTime (e.g. 9:30 am). It is not bulletproof and may produce an invalid timeOptions computed property otherwise.

props.name: timeFormat
props.description: The format of the value for v-model (options: h,H,i,a,A)

props.name: displayFormat
props.description: The format of the displayed time and options in the list (options: h,H,i,a,A)

props.name: minTime
props.description: The minimum time for the options list

props.name: maxTime
props.description: The maximum time fore the options list

props.name: listHeight
props.description: The height of the options list

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether or not disable the input

props.name: endOfDay
props.description: Enables the selection of "End of day" times like 11:59 PM or 23:59

methods.name: setTime(time)
methods.description: Sets the time of the timepicker to the given value

methods.name: selectTimeAtIndex(index)
methods.description: Sets the time to the time at the given index in the list of options

methods.name: resetList()
methods.description: Resets the list to it's original options (removes filtering)

methods.name: resetFocus()
methods.description: Resets the focus of the element and closes the options

methods.name: open()
methods.description: Opens the list of options

methods.name: close()
methods.description: Closes the list of options

props.name: steps
props.description:
An array of the steps. This will be the text used for the steps. Here is what was used in the example above. 
['Create Idea', 'Build Idea', 'Profit']

props.name: activeStep
props.description: The active step to be used. This can be binded with v-model.

props.name: allowInteraction
props.description: When this is enabled it allows users to click the steps to navigate. It is disabled by default.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when step is modified

methods.name: completeStep()
methods.description: Call this to complete the active step and advance to the next step.

methods.name: nextStep()
methods.description: Moves to the next step without completing

methods.name: setStep()
methods.description: Sets the step to the given value

props.name: isActive
props.description: Whether the tooltip is active or not. When false tooltip will not trigger

props.name: trigger
props.description: The trigger for showing the tooltip. hover, click

props.name: width
props.description: The width of the tooltip window. (auto by default)

props.name: height
props.description: The height of the tooltip window. (auto by default)

props.name: target
props.default: The target ref name from the tooltips parent component. if left blank it will assume the parent is the target

props.name: hideDelay
props.description: Delay in ms for hiding the tooltip

props.name: hoverDelay
props.description: When set, Delay in ms for showing the tooltip.

methods.name: showTooltip()
methods.description: Shows the tooltip.

methods.name: triggerHide()
methods.description: Hides the tooltip.

methods.name: toggleTooltip()
methods.description: Toggles the tooltip

props.name: name
props.description: This is the name given to the select and also it will be assumed as the itemKey if no itemKey is provided

props.name: labelKey
props.description: This is used in the filtering as users type it is also used to display the selection

props.name: value
props.description: This is the prop that the v-model will bind to. So if you are using v-model you can omit this.

props.name: items
props.description:
This is the list of options. 
[{Option data...},{Option data...}]

props.name: placeholder
props.description: The placeholder in the select when nothing is selected.

props.name: searchThreshold
props.description: The minimum number of items for the search input to be shown.

props.name: disableSearch
props.description: Whether or not to disable the search field.

props.name: itemFilter
props.description: When a function is provided it will be used when filtering results from the search box. The function should accept the item as a parameter and should return true for a match. If a String is provided it is used as the key to filter on when filtering items.

props.name: itemKey
props.description: This is the key used as the value for the items.

props.name: listHeight
props.description: The height of the drop down list

props.name: minSearch
props.description: Minimum number of characters typed in the search box needed to trigger the search

props.name: groupBy
props.description: The key to group items by. Dot notation is supported for nested values in the items.

props.name: singleDeselect
props.description: Allows users to deselect a selected option.

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disables the select

props.name: forceValues
props.description: When set to true the v-model will bind to the value key instead of the entire object.

props.name: multiple
props.description: Whether or not to support multiple selections

props.name: cacheResults
props.description: Whether or not to cache search results.

props.name: paginated
props.description: Whether or not the search data is being paginated. When true the select will emit the search event when the list is navigated to the end.

props.name: paginateThreshold
props.description: Determines when the paginate request will be called. So when the user scrolls down the list if this is set to 3 the request will be made when the user is 3 list items away from the bottom of the list.

props.name: stopParentScroll
props.description: When set to true the list will automatically prevent the parent container from scrolling when the list scroll has reached the bottom.

props.name: emptyMessage
props.description: A message to use when the select is empty. (ex: "No Results"). If left blank then no message will show up.

props.name: acceptEmptySelection
props.description: Works with the emptyMessage property. If this is set to true the empty option will be a selectable item instead of just text.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the value is changed

events.name: focus
events.description: Fired when the input field is focused.

events.name: blur
events.description: Fired when the input field is blurred

events.name: clear
events.description: Fired when the list is cleared

events.name: search

methods.name: open()
methods.description: Used to open the select dropdown

methods.name: close()
methods.description: Used to close the select dropdown

methods.name: toggleOpen()
methods.description: Used to toggle the select dropdown

methods.name: selectItem(item_index)
methods.description: Called to select an item. Expects the index of the item in the list.

methods.name: selectUp()
methods.description: Moves the selection up

methods.name: selectDown()
methods.description: Moves the selection down

methods.name: clear()
methods.description: Clears the search field

methods.name: clearCache()
methods.description: Clears the search cache

methods.name: getSelectedItem()
methods.description: Retrieves the selected item from list

methods.name: getItemByIndex(item_index)
methods.description: Retrieves an item by the given index

methods.name: refreshSelected()
methods.description: Updates the selects display. This should not be needed since the select will automatically refresh the display

methods.name: reset()
methods.description: Clears selection, items, and cache

slots.name: default
slots.description: This is a scoped slot. This is used so that you have more control over the look of the data. The component loops through the data and passes the props with a props attribute. An example can be seem above in autocomplete and pagination examples.

slots.name: label
slots.description: This is a scoped slot. This will be used to show the selection. If no selection is made it will not render this slot. It will take a scope of {value: ..., label}. An example can be seen above.

props.name: pagination
props.description: This is the main data that the paginator uses to operate

props.name: limit
props.description: This is the limit to how pages should be shown at once. An ellipsis will be placed when it exceeds this limit

props.name: routed
props.description: When set to true instead of emitting an event the paginator will write directly to the router query

props.name: pageVar
props.description: The variable name to be used when writing the route query

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the page is changed. Only fired when routed is not true

props.name: expand
props.description: When set to true the tabs will expand into an even width

props.name: align
props.description: Where to text align the tabs name. Options are ('left', 'center', 'right')

props.name: id
props.description: When provided the last active tab will be remembered unless the rememberTab prop is set to false

props.name: rememberTab
props.description: Only used when an ID is provided in case you want to use an id without remembering the tab selection.

props.name: title
props.description: When set to true the tabs will expand into an even width

events.name: tab-changed
events.description: Fired when the tab content is changed

events.name: active
events.description: Fired when the tab is activated

events.name: inactive
events.description: Fired when the tab is de-activated

methods.name: setActiveTab(tabTitle)
methods.description: Sets the active tab. Expects a paramter of the title

methods.name: setActive(Boolean active)
methods.description: Sets the tab to be the active tab. Expects a boolean

slots.name: default
slots.description: This is where the ks-tabs will be.

slots.name: default
slots.description: This is where the tab content will be. By default the non-active tabs are not in the DOM. So the mounted will not be called until it is the active tab.

props.name: message
props.description: The message that the toast will display

props.name: type
props.description: The type of message. Options are the same as alerts. (info, warning, error, success)

props.name: position
props.description: Where the toast should appear. Options are top-right, top, top-left, bottom-right, bottom, bottom-left

props.name: duration
props.description: How long the toast should appear. If 0 is passed the toast will require the user to click to close

props.name: limit
props.description: The number of toast that are on screen at once

methods.name: show()
methods.description: Show the toast. Or if the limit has been reached the toast will be added to the queue.

methods.name: close()
methods.description: Closes the toast message.

_data.text:
## Flexbox

#### Flex Direction

<styles-table :classes="direction"></styles-table>

#### Flex Wrap

<styles-table :classes="wrap"></styles-table>

#### Flex Align

<styles-table :classes="align"></styles-table>

<styles-table :classes="justify"></styles-table>

#### Flex Align Self

<styles-table :classes="align-self"></styles-table>

_data.title: Shadows Utilities
_data.text:
#### Default Box Shadow Map

```sass
$shadows: (
    'shadow-sm': 0 1px 1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2),
    'shadow': 0 1px 3px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2),
    'shadow-lg': 0 5px 15px -2px #aaa,
    'shadow-none': none,
);
```

_data.title: Spacing Utilities

children.value: There are three types of spacing utilities, padding, margin, and negative margin. Each of these has the similar class name with a different prefix.

_data.text:
### Spacing Default Map There are three types of spacing utilities, padding, margin, and negative margin. Each of these has the similar class name with a different prefix.
Prefixes: - padding - "p" - margin - "m" - negative margin - "-m" Modifiers: - All - "{prefix}-{size}" - Top - "{prefix}**t**-{size}" - Bottom - "{prefix}**b**-{size}" - Right - "{prefix}**r**-{size}" - Left - "{prefix}**l**-{size}" - Top & Bottom - "{prefix}**y**-{size}" - Right & Left - "{prefix}**x**-{size}"
#### Default Sizing Map ```sass $spacing: ( '0': 0, '0\\.5': 0.125rem, '1': 0.25rem, '1\\.5': 0.375rem, '2': 0.5rem, '2\\.5': 0.625rem, '3': 0.75rem, '4': 1rem, '5': 1.25rem, '6': 1.5rem, '8': 2rem, '10': 2.5rem, '12': 3rem, '16': 4rem, '20': 5rem, '24': 6rem, '32': 8rem, '40': 10rem, '48': 12rem, '56': 14rem, '64': 16rem, ); ```

classes.name: heading
